channel.title: Progress Report code please?
channel.description: Just wanted to add a touch to my script with a P.R. Post the [i]code[/i] beneath please. Many thanks - Snubb Gubb.

item.title: Progress Report code please?
item.dc:creator: @r_ch_e r!ch!e
item.description:
@r_ch_e wrote:

sigh

ok this should of explained where you place q:= q + 1;

so it would end up like...

Code:
procedure kill;
begin
//stuff; //cant be bothered to make something up
q:= q + 1;
end;

and in every time you have killed a cow it goes up. The cow counter should now be explained.

It refers to runescape because if you make a script it will count how many cows the script you made kills.

Understand

Read full topic

item.title: Progress Report code please?
item.dc:creator: @Run_From_Aut Run From Aut
item.description:
@Run_From_Aut wrote:

Read full topic

item.title: Progress Report code please?
item.dc:creator: @r_ch_e r!ch!e
item.description:
@r_ch_e wrote:

ok… so this is your cow killin procedure.

procedure kill; begin //stuff; //cant be bothered to make something up :P end;

just add.

q:= q + 1;

so it would end up like…

procedure kill; begin //stuff; //cant be bothered to make something up :P q:= q + 1; end;

so q is the holder for the amount of cows killed.
when each cow is killed we call on q:= q + 1;
this (and i hope you know this) increases the value of q by 1.
now in the prog report we call on the amount of cows killed (which is q).

Hope That Helps.

Read full topic

item.title: Progress Report code please?
item.dc:creator: @r_ch_e r!ch!e
item.description:
@r_ch_e wrote:

well using the form editor i would place a memo box in the form and use…

Memo1.Lines.Add

procedure report; begin Memo1.Lines.Add('[][][][][][][][][][][][][][][]'); Memo1.Lines.Add(' thx for using '); Memo1.Lines.Add(' run from auts '); Memo1.Lines.Add(' name of script'); Memo1.Lines.Add(' did something'+ inttostr(q) +' timess '); Memo1.Lines.Add('[][][][][][][][][][][][][][][]'); end;

ill make it in a minute

here it is… everything is explained within.

[code](* Created By: r!ch!e
reason: To demonstrate how a progress report can be used in a form
*)

program progreportinaform;

// form vars
var
frmDesign : TForm;
Memo1 : TMemo;
Button1 : TButton;

// other vars
var
q : Integer; // something counter

// this is the prog report procedure
// Memo1.Lines.Add(’’); is the same as writeln but it writes the strings
// to the memo instead of the debug box.
procedure report;
begin
Memo1.Lines.Add(’[][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][]’);
Memo1.Lines.Add(’ thx for using ‘);
Memo1.Lines.Add(’ run from auts ‘);
Memo1.Lines.Add(’ name of script’);
Memo1.Lines.Add(’ did something ‘+ inttostr(q) +’ times ‘);
Memo1.Lines.Add(’[][][][][][][][][][][][][][][[][][][][][][][][]’);
end;

//ends the script. this procedure is called by the button
procedure ButtonClick(sender: TObject);
begin
WriteLn(‘Script Ended’);
frmDesign.Caption:= frmDesign.Caption + ‘.’;
frmDesign.ModalResult:= mrOk;
end;

//form
procedure InitForm;
begin
frmDesign := CreateForm;
frmDesign.Left := 250;
frmDesign.Top := 114;
frmDesign.Width := 336;
frmDesign.Height := 374;
frmDesign.Caption := ‘frmDesign’;
frmDesign.Color := clBtnFace;
frmDesign.Font.Color := clWindowText;
frmDesign.Font.Height := -11;
frmDesign.Font.Name := ‘MS Sans Serif’;
frmDesign.Font.Style := [];
frmDesign.Visible := False;
frmDesign.PixelsPerInch := 96;
Memo1 := TMemo.Create(frmDesign);
Memo1.Parent := frmDesign;
Memo1.Left := 44;
Memo1.Top := 29;
Memo1.Width := 238;
Memo1.Height := 201;
Memo1.TabOrder := 8;
//Memo1.Font.Color := clred; // change the colour of the text if you want
Memo1.Font.Height := -16; // makes font bigger
report; // this calls on the procedure report…which adds the lines to the report.
Button1 := TButton.Create(frmDesign);
Button1.OnClick := @ButtonClick; // calls on the buttonclick procedure
Button1.Parent := frmDesign;
Button1.Left := 113;
Button1.Top := 280;
Button1.Width := 75;
Button1.Height := 25;
Button1.Caption := ‘OK!’;
Button1.TabOrder := 9;
end;

procedure SafeInitForm;
var
v: TVariantArray;
begin
setarraylength(V, 0);
ThreadSafeCall(‘InitForm’, v);
end;

procedure ShowFormModal;
begin
frmDesign.ShowModal;
end;

procedure SafeShowFormModal;
var v: TVariantArray;
begin setarraylength(V, 0);
ThreadSafeCall(‘ShowFormModal’, v);
end;

begin
//something procedures and other stuff stuff.
//displays form.
SafeInitForm;
SafeShowFormModal;
end.
-Hope that helps.[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Progress Report code please?
item.dc:creator: @Run_From_Aut Run From Aut
item.description:
@Run_From_Aut wrote:

Thank you for actually including the code, which was helpful. Anyone know how to put it so it opens up in the CMD Prompts or something other than the De Bug box? I need style :p[br][size=1]Posted at: November 26, 2006, 03:15:25 AM[/size][hr][quote=“r!ch!e, post:2, topic:29354”]procedure report;
begin
writeln(’|---------------------------|’);
writeln(’| ThankYou For Using… |’);
writeln(’| Run From Aut’s |’);
writeln(’| name of script |’);
writeln(’| Did something:(inttostring(an integer variable)) times!! |’);
writeln(’|---------------------------|’);
end;

Like that? ;)[/quote]You cant say . . .Aut’s. Has to be Aut’'s otherwise you end the text.

Read full topic

item.title: Progress Report code please?
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

try out this
[scar]program New;
const q=1;
procedure report;
begin
writeln(’[][][][][][][][][][][][][][][]’);
writeln(’ thx for using ‘);
writeln(’ nuebs cow killer ‘);
writeln(’ moparisthebest.com FTW! ‘);
writeln(’ killed ‘+ inttostr(q) +’ cows ‘);
writeln(’[][][][][][][][][][][][][][][]’);
end;
begin
report
end.[/scar]
